page.title: 05EDUCATION NETT'M & DISTRICT
page.content: The Playgroup opened in 1966,run by a parent committee,it has 3 Supervisors and a rota of mother helpers.The group of 24 children meet in the village hall 9.15-noon mon- thurs.,at a cost of 80p per session. The County Infant School,opened in 1970,has a head,Secretary,5 Teachers, 5 Dinner Supervisors,caretaker 69 girls and 76 boys.The C.of E. Aided Junior School opened in 1967,has a Head,Secretary,7 Teachers,3 Dinner Supervisors,Caretaker 107 boys and 99 girls.All 3 Nettleham Schools use its heated pool.Sudbrooke has no playgroup or schools at present,though there are about 150 children 0-11 years old. SCOTHERN Playgroups for 30. 130 5-11 in C.E.School built 1837,building due for replacement but controversy over its siting.
